trial_identification.studytitle: Investigative Headgear With Nasal Pillows Continuous Positive Airway Pressure (CPAP) Mask
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Investigative Headgear With Nasal Pillows CPAP Mask

interventions.interventions:
Treatment: devices - Investigative Headgear with CPAP mask
Experimental: Headgear - Investigative Headgear with CPAP mask
Treatment: devices: Investigative Headgear with CPAP mask Investigative Headgear with CPAP mask

primaryOutcome.outcome: Reliability of the headgear using a Questionnaire - Assessment of headgear properties on a monthly basis via custom questionnaire via phone call
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Monthly over a period of 6 months

primaryOutcome.outcome: Durability of the headgear by testing - Assessment of headgear properties on a monthly basis, and changes to the headgear
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Monthly over a period of 6 months

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Performance in regards to leak of the headgear - Objective Leak Data (L/min) from the device download
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Monthly over a period of 6 months

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Performance in regards to comfort of the headgear - Custom Questionnaire
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Monthly over a period of 6 months

eligibility.inclusivecriteria:
- AHI=5 from the diagnostic night
- =18 years of age
- Prescribed CPAP or Bi-level therapy for OSA
- Existing F&P Pilairo Q, Eson, Simplus mask users
eligibility.exclusivecriteria:
- Inability to give informed consent
- Patient intolerant to CPAP
- Anatomical or physiological conditions making CPAP therapy inappropriate
- History of respiratory disease or carbon dioxide (CO2) retention
- Pregnant or think they may be pregnant
- Investigated by Land Transport Safety Authority

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This investigation is designed to evaluate the at-home usability, performance, user acceptance and reliability of the headgear with a CPAP mask for a duration of 6 months.
